snippet: A study that shows widespread failure in ovarian-cancer treatment suggests a need for new ways to help patients and doctors find specialists who can help them.
abstract: Editorial cites study from conference on gynecologic cancers finding widespread failure, one that is not uncommon in American medicine, among doctors to follow clinical guidelines for treating ovarian cancer; holds surest way to improve performance is to analyze and make public how well individual doctors and hospitals do in treating various diseases.
lead_paragraph: A study that shows widespread failure in ovarian-cancer treatment suggests a need for new ways to help patients and doctors find specialists who can help them.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
